metadata.title: Hello Z-- World
metadata.description:
Welcome to Z--! Your first challenge is simple: write a program that prints "Hello, Z-- World!" to the console.

## Learning Objectives
- Understand basic Z-- syntax
- Learn about the `start`/`end` block structure
- Use the `print()` function
- Work with string literals

## Z-- Language Basics
Z-- programs are structured with `start` and `end` blocks. The `print()` function outputs text to the console, and string literals use double quotes.
metadata.author: Z-Challenge Team

problem.statement: Write a Z-- program that prints exactly "Hello, Z-- World!" to the console.

examples.explanation: The program should output this exact string to the console.

hints: Use the print() function to output text
String literals in Z-- use double quotes
Remember to wrap your code in start/end blocks

editorial.approach: This is a basic output challenge. Simply use the print() function with the required string literal.
